question_text: What distinguishes a Type 1 hypervisor in terms of system architecture?
answer_options: It requires a full-featured host operating system to function
It runs applications directly without guest operating systems
It installs on top of a host OS and shares drivers
It runs directly on physical hardware and manages guest OSes independently
correct_answer: It runs directly on physical hardware and manages guest OSes independently
explanation: Type 1 hypervisors (bare metal) act as the OS on the system, providing direct access to hardware for managing VMs.
